snippet: The minister, Yanis Varoufakis, said the “soul” of the central bank’s chief, Mario Draghi, was “filled with fear” at the idea of forgiving Greek debt.
abstract: Greek Finance Min Yanis Varoufakis criticizes European Cental Bank chief Mario Draghi in dramatic statement; separate comments from Varoufakis are interpreted as threat not to pay back billions of euros that Greece owes bank; bank's Governing Council, already weary of what they see as irresponsible behavior, are expected to place further restrictions on emergency cash it provides to shore up Greek banking system.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: The minister, Yanis Varoufakis, said the “soul” of the central bank’s chief, Mario Draghi, was “filled with fear” at the idea of forgiving Greek debt.

headline.main: Greek Finance Minister Lashes Out at E.C.B. Chief
headline.print_headline: Greece’s Outspoken Finance Minister Says the E.C.B.’s Chief Fears Germany
